results.title: This is working
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight, Film Australia and National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee
results.brief_description: Aboriginal people suffer an unemployment rate six times higher than the white community. Shows Aboriginal people in New South Wales who are working on four different job creation projects. Features, amongst others, Bill Powell, Aboriginal Liaison Officer TAFE, Rose Kirby, Murrin Bridge Handcraft Industries, Des Simon, apprentice carpenter, Purfleet and Dallas Carberry, park management trainee, Orient Point.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight, Film Australia and National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee

results.title: Bread and dripping
results.creator_credit: Women's Film Collective, Margot Nash and Wimins Films
results.brief_description: The role of the women during the Great Depression has often been neglected in the telling of Australian history. Using archival footage, this film illustrates the hardships and the political struggles women faced in a time of political and economic upheaval.

results.title: Highway improvements
results.brief_description: Details of planning and improvements of Victorian state highways, including climbing lanes for slow traffic, duplicate pavements, elimination of railroad crossings and development of by-pass roads.

results.title: Water birds of the inland
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows general feeding and nesting habits of a variety of inland water birds at Narran Lake, Western NSW (also known as Terewah Lake) and its surrounding marshy area.

results.title: News digest [No. 9]
results.creator_credit: ABC and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Kyabram’s rodeo; 12,000 sea shells collected from the world’s beaches; Victoria’s first mobile water patrol equipped with a bar tender cruiser is launched at Sandringham; underwater enthusiasts collect relics from old steamers; movies on the move at the Myer Music Bowl shown by the State Film Centre on a 24 by 8 foot screen as part of the Moomba festivities.

results.title: Viewpoint on Adelaide
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The city of Adelaide, South Australia, as seen through the eyes of European migrants. Becoming accustomed to Australia was the main problem of migrants in this film. The language barrier, strange customs and the long hours of work required to become established are discussed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lilias Fraser, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Seeing red and feeling blue
results.creator_credit: Jane Oehr, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Provides basic information about reproduction and aspects of menstruation, and probes emotional responses on many aspects of womanhood. The Women’s Theatre Group of Melbourne performs improvisations and satirical sketches which comment on many of society’s prevailing attitudes towards sex education and women.

results.title: Nests in the bush
results.brief_description: A classroom film for young children on how different Australian birds build and conceal their nests and rear their young. Yellow robin, wren, loterill, honey-eater and wagtail are among those seen.
results.description: A classroom film for young children on how different Australian birds build and conceal their nests and rear their young. Yellow robin, wren, loterill, honey-eater and wagtail are among those seen.

results.title: The Fire brigade
results.creator_credit: Joan Boundy and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The story of training a young recruit in every aspect of his duty as a fireman attached to a large metropolitan fire brigade. Equipment is demonstrated in detail, including its actual use in a spectacular city fire.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joan Boundy and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Farewell to charms
results.creator_credit: Carla Pontiac, Carole Sklan and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: An experimental feminist film which questions the goals of love and romance as a woman’s ultimate fulfillment. Emma, vivacious but suicidal terrorist is reunited with Cecily, her old school chum. They meet a ‘bionic bike dyke’ called stretch and break open the jelly beans. Will they stretch a point over the pool table? Will tap-dancing and vaginal exercises be enough for Cecily? Will Emma metamorphose into Esther Williams? True romance. Cast includes Radda Jordan, Helen Pankhurst.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carla Pontiac, Carole Sklan and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
